definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses

sentences.english: Do you still recall the frightful night we crossed the Rio Grande?
sentences.chinese: 你還記得我們穿過邊疆鐵騎軍，那個可怕的晚上嗎？

sentences.english: All at once, the cuirassiers, who had been the assailants, found themselves assailed.
sentences.chinese: 那些攻人的鐵騎軍忽然覺得自己被攻了。

sentences.english: But German team's first competition poured under the Australian team's cavalries .
sentences.chinese: 而德國隊的首場比賽則倒在了澳大利亞隊的鐵騎之下。

sentences.english: His famous "Ironside" cavalry and New Model Army defeated the king.
sentences.chinese: 他著名的鐵騎軍和新模範軍擊敗了國王。

sentences.english: Sixty cannons and the thirteen squares darted lightning point-blank on the cuirassiers.
sentences.chinese: 六十尊大炮和十三個方陣同時向着鐵騎軍劈面射來。

sentences.english: All at once, the cuirassiers, who had been the assailants , found themselves assailed.
sentences.chinese: 那些攻人的鐵騎軍突然覺得自己被攻了。

sentences.english: Our steeds galloped at the Great Pass as autumn winds blow.
sentences.chinese: 在雄關旁，我們的鐵騎在秋風中馳騁。

sentences.english: The cuirassiers had not succeeded, since the centre was not broken through.
sentences.chinese: 鐵騎軍絲毫沒有成功，由於他們並沒有突破中部防線。

definition: the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness

Hong Taiji (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor/posthumous name 清太宗
